forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West wind 13 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 61. West wind 16 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.

weather_report:
As the early morning settles over Downtown San Francisco, a veil of clouds lingers in the night sky, whispering hints of the chill to come. The air, crisp and bracing, embraces the city with temperatures nudging around 52 degrees. A steady west wind, brisk at times, carries with it the familiar tang of the bay, rustling leaves and encouraging a sense of calm as it sweeps through the streets. The promise of the day unfolds gently, bringing with it the hope for sunshine and clarity. 

By midday, the clouds will part, revealing a bright blue canvas speckled with the occasional fluffy white. The high will hover around 61 degrees, inviting residents to venture out, albeit with a light layer against the capricious breeze. Dressing in a comfortable sweater or a light jacket—perhaps even one with pockets for essentials—will provide both warmth and readiness for the journey ahead. With such delightful weather on hand, one might stroll through the city’s neighborhoods, exploring hidden cafés or perhaps lose themselves in one of the many independent bookstores. It is a day ripe for gentle wanderings, punctuated by the occasional pause to watch the world’s fleet of boats dance gracefully on the water, their sails catching the wind just right.
